---
title: 'Usage'
order: 4
componentName: 'button'
category: 'components'
subCategory: 'actions'
customPath: '/components/actions/button'
---

Buttons communicate actions that users can take.

### Principles

- Buttons should indicate that they can trigger an action.
- Buttons should be easy to find among other elements, including other buttons.
- A button's action and state should be clear.

#### Text label

<TextLayoutLeft>

Text labels describe the action that will occur if a user taps a button. If a text label is not used, an icon should be present to signify what the button does. Text labels should be short, concise and descriptive.

</TextLayoutLeft>

<Stances>
  <Bad>
    <Example>
      <ButtonPrimary>
        Some over-descriptive label
      </ButtonPrimary>
    </Example>
    <Description>
      Do not use long labels
    </Description>
  </Bad>
  <Good>
    <Example>
      <ButtonPrimary>
        Action
      </ButtonPrimary>
    </Example>
    <Description>
      Use short and distinct labels for the action
    </Description>
  </Good>
</Stances>


#### Sizing

<TextLayoutLeft>

Buttons have a minimum width of `48px`, and a maximum width of `320px`. Other than that, the width is set to grow with the length of the text.

Buttons can also be larger or smaller, with a maximum height of `64px` and a minimum height of `24px`. Usage of larger buttons are very strict, and in most cases should be avoided.

</TextLayoutLeft>


<Types>
  <Type column={true}>
    <Example>
      <div class="if" style="display:flex;flex-wrap: wrap; grid-gap:2rem 2rem;margin-bottom: 2rem;">
        <button style="margin:0;" data-speccer-measure="height left" type="button" class="if button primary large">Large button</button>
        <button style="margin:0;" type="button" class="if button primary">Button</button>
        <button style="margin:0;" type="button" class="if button primary small">Small button</button>
        <button style="margin:0;" type="button" class="if button primary smaller">Smaller button</button>
      </div>
      <div class="if" style="display:flex;flex-wrap: wrap; grid-gap:2rem 2rem;">
        <button style="margin:0;" data-speccer-measure="height left" type="button" class="if button secondary large">Large button</button>
        <button style="margin:0;" type="button" class="if button secondary">Button</button>
        <button style="margin:0;" type="button" class="if button secondary small">Small button</button>
        <button style="margin:0;" type="button" class="if button secondary smaller">Smaller button</button>
      </div>
    </Example>
  <Description>
  </Description>
  </Type>
</Types>


#### A single primary button

<TextLayoutLeft>

A layout/view should contain a single primary button that makes it clear that other buttons have less importance in the hierarchy. This primary button commands the most attention.

</TextLayoutLeft>

#### Other buttons

<TextLayoutLeft>

An view can show more than one button in a layout at a time, so a primary button can be accompanied by secondary or text buttons that perform less important actions.

</TextLayoutLeft>

#### Placement

<Stances>
  <Bad>
    <Example>
      <button type="button" class="if button primary">No</button>
      <button type="button" class="if button primary">Yes</button>
    </Example>
    <Description>
    Do not use two or more primary buttons together
    </Description>
  </Bad>
  <Good>
    <Example>
      <button type="button" class="if button secondary">No</button>
      <button type="button" class="if button primary">Yes</button>
    </Example>
    <Description>
    Only use one primary button per view
    </Description>
  </Good>
</Stances>

### With icons

All buttons can have icons.

#### Placement {#button-width-icons-placement}

<TextLayoutLeft>

It is preferred that icons are placed to the left of the text. In some occasions, like with navigational buttons, you can place arrows to the right.

</TextLayoutLeft>

<Stances>
  <Bad>
    <Example>
      <button type="button" class="if button secondary">Download<span class="if icon ui data-download blue" aria-hidden="true" style="margin-right: 0;margin-left: 16px;"></span></button>
    </Example>
    <Description>
      Do not place icons to the right of the text
    </Description>
  </Bad>
  <Good>
    <Example>
      <button type="button" class="if button info">View prices<span class="if icon ui arrow-right white" aria-hidden="true" style="margin-right: 0;margin-left: 16px;"></span></button>
    </Example>
    <Description>
      But you can do it with arrows
    </Description>
  </Good>
  <Good>
    <Example>
      <button type="button" class="if button primary"><span class="if icon ui data-download white" aria-hidden="true"></span>Download</button>
    </Example>
    <Description>
      Place icons to the left of the text
    </Description>
  </Good>
</Stances>
